channel.title: ::(place) (name)
channel.description:
Hey I have a questions. How do i make it so when i do a command such as ::52wild (name)
like i will type a command and then a player name and that player will teleport to a certain command. Please help i will rep

item.title: ::(place) (name)
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Zerk P0wer, post:23, topic:412571”]everyone stop replying bullshizzel.

Just use this command, it works perfectly, also tested it on my own server.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("52wild") || playerCommand.startsWith("52Wild") || playerCommand.startsWith("52wILD") || playerCommand.startsWith("52WILD") && c.playerRights == 3) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.teleportToX = 2710; c2.teleportToY = 3515; c2.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + c2.playerName + " to lEVEL 52 Wilderness"); c2.sendMessage("<shad=39456421>You have been teleported to Level 52 Wilderness By: " + c.playerName); c2.sendMessage("<shad=39456421>You have been teleported to Level 52 Wilderness!"); } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }[/quote]
Disgusting l2useEclipse, and not call it in a static way.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("52wild") || playerCommand.startsWith("52Wild") || playerCommand.startsWith("52wILD") || playerCommand.startsWith("52WILD") && c.playerRights == 3) { try { String other = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < PlayerHandler.players.length; i++) { if(PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(other)) { Client c2 = (Client)PlayerHandler.players[i]; c2.teleportToX = 2710; c2.teleportToY = 3515; c2.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + c2.playerName + " to lEVEL 52 Wilderness"); c2.sendMessage("<shad=39456421>You have been teleported to Level 52 Wilderness By: " + c.playerName); c2.sendMessage("<shad=39456421>You have been teleported to Level 52 Wilderness!"); } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: ::(place) (name)
item.dc:creator: @Zerk_P0wer Zerk P0wer
item.description:
@Zerk_P0wer wrote:

everyone stop replying bullshizzel.

Just use this command, it works perfectly, also tested it on my own server.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("52wild") || playerCommand.startsWith("52Wild") || playerCommand.startsWith("52wILD") || playerCommand.startsWith("52WILD") && c.playerRights == 3) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.teleportToX = 2710; c2.teleportToY = 3515; c2.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + c2.playerName + " to lEVEL 52 Wilderness"); c2.sendMessage("<shad=39456421>You have been teleported to Level 52 Wilderness By: " + c.playerName); c2.sendMessage("<shad=39456421>You have been teleported to Level 52 Wilderness!"); } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

item.title: ::(place) (name)
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“expozee, post:15, topic:412571”]here you go

[code=asp]if(playerCommand.startsWith(“52wild”)) {
try {
String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7);
for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
c2.teleportToX = coords;
c2.teleportToY = coords;
c2.sendMessage(“You have been teled by “+c.playerName+”.”);
c.sendMessage(“Successfully teled “+c2.playerName+”.”);
}
}
}
} catch(Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player Must Be Offline.”);
}
}

}[/code][/quote]Thats terrible grammar in your code... When I code from a base my first thing is to correct grammar mistakes. For example: When you teleport out of Godwars I used to get the message "You killcount was [b]reseted[/b]... sad dude. You have "teled"... should be "tele'd" but more professionally "teleported."

Read full topic

here you go

[code=asp]if(playerCommand.startsWith(“52wild”)) {
try {
String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7);
for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
c2.teleportToX = coords;
c2.teleportToY = coords;
c2.sendMessage(“You have been teled by “+c.playerName+”.”);
c.sendMessage(“Successfully teled “+c2.playerName+”.”);
}
}
}
} catch(Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player Must Be Offline.”);
}
}

}[/code]
